panels.visual: Wide establishing shot of the Iron Gates at sunset - ancient weathered pillars marking the boundary where settled lands give way to nomad territory. The sun bleeds crimson across the horizon. The caravan makes camp within sight of the monuments. Beyond those markers, the world takes on a different character.
panels.narration: On the third evening, as the sun bled crimson across the horizon, they made camp within sight of the Iron Gates.

panels.visual: The group gathered around the fire - Giovanni, Bansi, Eskil in his helm, Gan with Dog at her feet, Lueduo, Sadia, Abu-Rayhan. The firelight plays across their diverse faces as they share stories of where they come from and what they seek. Trust building between strangers.
panels.dialogue: Lueduo: "Among my people, there is a tradition of speaking stories when the coals burn low."

panels.visual: Eskil works on a blade by firelight, offering to repair their weapons. Giovanni checks his daggers, expression contemplative. His hands move with familiar ease over the weapons despite his priest's robes. Bansi and Sadia have taken the first watch, visible in the darkness beyond.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "I find myself a stranger in strange lands. A barbarian I may be, for I am no stranger to violence."
panels.narration: The sharing of tales builds trust.
